org.smartfrog.tools.ant
Class TaskBase

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      org.apache.tools.ant.Task
          org.smartfrog.tools.ant.TaskBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Parse, SmartFrogTask
public abstract class TaskBase
extends org.apache.tools.ant.Task

This is a foundation task that manages classpath setup for everything underneath.

init

public void init()
          throws org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException
Called by the project to let the task initialize properly. The default implementation is a no-op.

Overrides:
init in class org.apache.tools.ant.Task
Throws:
org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException - if something goes wrong with the build

isDebug

public boolean isDebug()
get at the debug switch.

Returns:
true iff the property SmartFrogJVMProperties.ANT_DEBUG_PROPERTY is true at init time

setIncludeAntRuntime

public void setIncludeAntRuntime(boolean includeAntRuntime)
Set the include ant run time policy. If a new classpath is passed in, should the existing one (used when declaring the task) be included? If it is not, the new classpath must include smartfrog.jar. Default: false.

Parameters:
includeAntRuntime - flag for the ant runtime

addClasspath

public void addClasspath(org.apache.tools.ant.types.Path classpath)
the classpath to run the parser

Parameters:
classpath - classpath element

a reference to the classpath to use to run smartfrog

Parameters:
classpathRef - classpath reference

createJavaTask

protected org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Java createJavaTask(java.lang.String entryPoint)
create a java task

Parameters:
entryPoint - class to run as main
Returns:
the java task ready to run

setupClasspath

protected void setupClasspath(org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Java java)
set the classpath to the first valid item from
  1. That of any classpath element
  2. That of any classpathref attribute
  3. If loaded by an AntClassLoader, by that loader's path
  4. the java.class.path

Parameters:
java - the java task to set up

bindToChild

public void bindToChild(org.apache.tools.ant.Task child)
set a child task up as bound to this. It is the inverse of Task.bindToOwner() in Ant1.7+, implemented here, adding a call to init() for good measure.

Parameters:
child - a child task
